content: Maybe the email was deleted automatically? Please also see this discussion: https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/outlook_com/forum/all/outlook-sends-not-read-receipts-from-empty-outbox/4e428dec-4cb2-4f50-9f22-a52842bac853

content:
I don't think that's all. I got the "Not Read" message 11 times for the same email and then, finally, got a message to say the email had been read and I got a reply! So it seems that, despite the reply, my original email was NOT deleted. Here's what they said:

"Your message 

  To: XXXXXXXXXX   Subject: Fwd: Customer Contact   Sent: Thursday, February 29, 2024 11:08:34 AM (UTC+00:00) Dublin, Edinburgh, Lisbon, London 
was deleted without being read on Thursday, February 29, 2024 3:28:46 PM (UTC+00:00) Dublin, Edinburgh, Lisbon, London.

Final-recipient: RFC822; XXXXXXXXX@XXXXXXXXX.com Disposition: automatic-action/MDN-sent-automatically; deleted X-MSExch-Correlation-Key: CWV24gPelkyuoeOQSyg6Lg== Original-Message-ID: <0de4b2cf-e67a-49d9-a7b5-9eeb670356a8@btinternet.com> X-Display-Name: XXXXXXXXXX

So, what caused the email to be marked as "automatically deleted" (when it wasn't).


I've only had this problem with 2 email addresses; 1 is from a UK hospital and the other from a large UK car dealership. It's strange that it happens VERY intermittently. I'm sure it's something or someone at the receiving end who's done something but I don't have a clue what!

content: I went to the Dark Reader site, read their info and skimmed through recent reviews. I won't use it because: 1. It's designed for Firefox, not for Thunderbird. I'm happy with Firefox as it is. I'm concerned about forwarding and responding to emails that apparently have some coding that offends the Thunderbird display machine. 2. Too many recent reviewers complain about excessive resource consumption, raising core temperature and slowing down the Firefox browser, sometimes to a crawl, causing Firefox to recommend turning off extensions. Glad it's working for you, and thanks for offering help.

content:
Sounds like Thunderbird does not have the necessary read write privileges to MSF files in that drive. Is you copy of Thunderbird actually installed? Is this the same if you restart from the help menu with troubleshooting mode?

You could just delete the relevant MSF files from the profile folder and they will be rebuilt when the application starts and the folder is accessed. But that you have the issue in the first place makes me wonder what is locking access to the relevant drive location.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Do you still see this if you restart Thunderbird in safe mode?

I have seen a lot of this sort of thing in recent years. Mostly from folk determined to read mail in a black screen with white text. Have you changed the default colour for text in the settings page? or disable the use of fonts other than your selection. Those are primary sources of this.

Other sources are those using broken mail clients that do not offer dark themes, so they manually force a white font colour in their mails. ( a very bad idea, but plenty of folk just don't think that far ahead to the recipient)

The fundamental issue is, is it something Thunderbird is doing, or something the sender is doing. Thunderbird will faithfully use the fonts the sender specified for quotes. You can over ride it in settings, but it a less than optimal outcome. But a better approach is reply that you are unable to read their formatted emails. Can they please send in a font other than white. Education, like personnel management works best with the personal approach, not a IT solution to control the issue.

I have recently seen a huge upswing in folk complaining about dark themes that instead of involving Thunderbird fall back to the windows dark theme and it's sub settings for apps to use light themes.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
This has been the dutch language support for a long time https://www.mozilla-nl.org/mozbrowser/forum/viewforum.php?f=3&sid=ab17d16fcad60e75d2f77f2b6f81c6e7

Around 10 years ago there were attempts made to get all support under one roof, but with volunteers, you do not get to force anyone. The dutch chose to stay where they were.

I played your game, and eventually got to an English language location to seek support. Given there is no Dutch support offered at this site, that is the best that we can do. Unless you are offering your time to answer questions in Dutch and have a few others willing to join you then there is not going to be a Dutch language support group on which to build a peer support forum in Dutch. The issue is not identifying gaps in what is offered. It is finding solutions, usually warm bodies prepared to give freely of their time. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/contribute

Note if you have issues with the forum, the best approach is to use a contributor account and post in the contributor forums.

For localization issues File bugs in bugzilla for the Product:support.mozilla.org Component:Localization

If you issue is with the forum software package, the location for that is with the github project https://github.com/mozilla/kitsune/issues

If you just have feedback or ideas then the feedback should be directed here https://connect.mozilla.org
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I doubt your "fix" is actually doing anything but whacking a Band-Aid over a hemorrhage. So thing go pear shaped on the very next released update because the underlying problem on your system has not been addressed.

I am forced to guess, because your description does not offer anything to go on, but generally the issue is Thunderbird was originally installed as a 32bit version and at some point in the last few years has been updated to a 64bit version. This means that the location the executable file is stored triggers Thunderbird to abandon your exiting profile. based on the rules it has for profile per install. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/dedicated-profile-thunderbird-installation

This "feature" is a royal PITA and the developers apparently just can not see the forest for the trees. They think it is great and my attempts over the years to get a sensible change implemented have not only fallen on deaf ears, the developers express a lack of understanding of just what the problem is. They do not grasp how infuriating the thing is to average people. (me included)

So your profiles.ini file is not corrupt, so proceeding like it is is just perpetuation the problem. Use the profile manager as described in the article, or the command line as I describe in this old bog post from 2019 to force Thunderbird to use the right profile, instead of applying the band-aid. https://thunderbirdtweaks.blogspot.com/2019/09/i-lost-my-profilemail-on-update-to.html

Once Thunderbird has been told this profile for this version of Thunderbird the ongoing issues should cease. At least until you move the profile to a new device, or change user names or change the 64 V 32 bit versions. (some have to revert to 32 bit version to make MAPI work from their accounting package.)
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
The question here is why is it still running and not responding?

It sounds like something is causing the application to hang when you exit. Please check in task manager to see if there is already a process running before you click the link. That will at least start the diagnostic process as to what is happening.

creator: sfhowes

content:
Try this. Go to Thunderbird settings on the menu search for address. About mid screen you should see "Show only display names from my address book" unchecked it.

I am guessing you have two individuals in the address book with the exact same email address, so Thunderbird is replacing the address on the incoming email with the first it finds in the address book.

Fundamentally it is actually a bad idea for husbands and wives to share an mail address. It appears to be fairly common in some localities especially in the USA, but it harks from a time when snail mail arrived at an address and it was then sorted as to which household member it was addressed to. What you are experiencing is that email really does not allow for this household addressing. You can make it sort of work. But eventually it will trip you up.

A friend of mine was doing something similar sharing an address and when her partner predeceased her she lost all access to the historical mail and access to the account because it was not "hers" for months. Until all the legal stuff with the estate was finalized.
creator: MattAuSupport
